newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights - USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights - USDA.

text.p: USDA cotton export sales highlights in latest reporting week:

Net Upland sales of 94,000 running bales (RB) were four-fifths above the previous week and equaled the 4-week average. The major increases were for unknown destinations (25,200 RB), Brazil (15,400 RB), China (12,300 RB), Mexico (9,100 RB), and Turkey (8,900 RB).
Sales of 50,300 RB for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year were primarily for El Salvador (11,300 RB), South Korea (8,200 RB), and Mexico (8,000 RB).

Exports of 160,700 RB slipped 5 percent below the previous week and 8 percent below the 4-week average. Asian destinations accounted for 63 percent of the week's shipments; Western Hemisphere, 21 percent; West European, 14 percent; and the Former Soviet Union, 2 percent.
